meanings.sent1: She was allotting the candies to the children.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was allotting the tasks to the students.
meanings.sent3: Allotting the cookies evenly among the friends led to smiles all around.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be allotting its warmth generously to the garden.
meanings.sent5: Allotting time for each activity made the day more organized.

meanings.definition: To assign a portion or share of something
meanings.sent1: He was allotting the budget for each department.
meanings.sent2: The manager was allotting responsibilities to the team members.
meanings.sent3: Allotting the chores fairly among the siblings avoided arguments.
meanings.sent4: The artist was allotting colors to different sections of the painting.
meanings.sent5: Allotting space for each plant in the garden ensured proper growth.
